result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edgar Perez Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edgar Perez Ramirez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Conner Helvig appeared by video for Edgar Perez Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ayala. Court took judicial notice of 18CF5636.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edgar Perez Ramirez not in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Edgar Perez Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Helvig has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 085519,
Payable Number: 1030272,
Receipt Number: 22RP035695,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Edgar Perez Ramirez not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with M. A. W.; Co- Defendant Sergio Palacio Flores
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court also ordered co-defendants be kept separate while in custody.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Edgar Perez Ramirez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Edgar Perez Ramirez.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
